issue.title: Allowing cmake to export project targets
issue.body:
Hello there,
I made a small tweak that allows inclusion of liboqs into other cmake projects using `add_subdirectory` and other funny tools.

So far, liboqs doesnt export any of its targets, and thus makes it more difficult to link against in other projects. This simple fix allows something like this to happen in a custom project:
```cmake
FetchContent_Declare(liboqs
    GIT_REPOSITORY https://github.com/onavratil-monetplus/liboqs
)
message(STATUS  "Fetching liboqs...this may take a while")
FetchContent_MakeAvailable(liboqs)
# ....

target_link_libraries(myCustomTarget PUBLIC OQS::oqs)
```
And boom! There we go, no need to install the lib system-wide prior to project build, allows to use static version of the lib etc etc etc.

Now I am nothing for a cmake professional, but this solution works nicely for me, and hopefully can help someone else as well.

On a footnote, the fix is based on a discussion regarding my desparate attempts to use cmake.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61504626/the-cmake-quandary

issue.title: Add tests for invalid ciphertexts to liboqs
issue.body: Rather than leaving them to fail in wrappers

comment.body: @vsoftco From your recent look at liboqs-go, do you have any ideas on what additional type of test beyond what we have now would be appropriate here in liboqs to detect that previous wrong ciphertext bug?

issue.title: Investigate errors apparently triggered by -DOQS_PORTABLE_BUILD=OFF
issue.body: Similar issue to #732 : Using gcc8 in Centos-8, Dilithium self-tests and KAT tests fail when running AVX2 code. On no other platform and neither using clang on Centos-8, this problem surfaces.

comment.body: I think we can close this.

issue.title: Should we add XMSS?

labels.name: future-work
labels.description: Will not be fixed in current release cycle

issue.body:
Seeing as how XMSS has been published as an [RFC](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8391.html) and that NIST is planning to endorse it, it seems like something that should be in the post-quantum toolkit provided by liboqs.

We'd need a new API for stateless signatures.

comment.body: Closing this for now while we focus on Round 3 schemes.

issue.title: Add options for iOS and Android cross-compilation
issue.body: I'm attempting to build liboqs for both iOS and Android for a Xamarin.Forms project, and haven't been able to manipulate the included build and configuration files to make that work. If it would be possible, add configuration or documentation to help with cross-compiling the library for iOS and Android, ideally targeting multiple processor configurations. Thanks!

comment.body: Just checking in to see if there are any updates to this work.

issue.title: NTRU sample.c requires update
Sync with PQClean
issue.body:
PQClean commit 383874f4082ab26a234e0e3428ee0f419e008765

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Major revisions to HQC algorithm suite.  Minor changes in NTRU and other algorithms.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [No] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [Yes] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding or removing?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: @baentsch I updated my PR here with the latest pull from PQClean.  Still running into some compilation problems with HQC code from PQClean having shadowed variables.  I thought that was fixed in https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/pull/332 but seems not.  So that's the current blocker for this PR.

issue.title: Allow building without std on nightly
Undefined behaviour in FireSaber-KEM
issue.body:
Hi!

I've been looking at the library and running some things, and this is a really nice work, so thanks for all!

I recently ran some tests, enabling clang's UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer using the build sequence:

```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DUSE_SANITIZER=Undefined -GNinja ..
ninja
```

My compiler is clang-11, and arch is x86_64-apple-darwin18.7.0

I ran onto several undefined behaviour, on some algorithms (I'm just pasting only one of each 'family'):


```
tests/test_kem FireSaber-KEM    
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Darwin-18.7.0
Compiler:         clang (11.0.0 (clang-1100.0.33.17))
OQS version:      0.4.0-rc1
Git commit:       477ef3f60cd04f9b72b499d000a8f77ae99c0d89 (+ local modifications)
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1g  21 Apr 2020)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            OpenSSL

================================================================================
Sample computation for KEM FireSaber-KEM
================================================================================
../src/kem/saber/pqclean_firesaber_clean/poly_mul.c:50:44: runtime error: signed integer overflow: 57354 * 40101 cannot be represented in type 'int'
shared secrets are equal
```

```
tests/test_kem FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Darwin-18.7.0
Compiler:         clang (11.0.0 (clang-1100.0.33.17))
OQS version:      0.4.0-rc1
Git commit:       477ef3f60cd04f9b72b499d000a8f77ae99c0d89 (+ local modifications)
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1g  21 Apr 2020)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            OpenSSL

================================================================================
Sample computation for KEM FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE
================================================================================
../src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo_macrify_optimized.c:281:34: runtime error: signed integer overflow: 65534 * 59141 cannot be represented in type 'int'
../src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo_macrify_optimized.c:281:28: runtime error: signed integer overflow: 39658 + 2147450877 cannot be represented in type 'int'
shared secrets are equal
```

```
tests/test_kem SIDH-p503-compressed
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Darwin-18.7.0
Compiler:         clang (11.0.0 (clang-1100.0.33.17))
OQS version:      0.4.0-rc1
Git commit:       477ef3f60cd04f9b72b499d000a8f77ae99c0d89 (+ local modifications)
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1g  21 Apr 2020)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            OpenSSL

================================================================================
Sample computation for KEM SIDH-p503-compressed
================================================================================
../src/kem/sike/external/P503/../compression/dlog.c:108:35: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/external/P503/../compression/dlog.c:96:39: runtime error: index 44 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/external/P503/../compression/dlog.c:98:39: runtime error: index 44 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/external/P503/../compression/dlog.c:115:35: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/external/P503/../compression/dlog.c:65:34: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/external/P503/../compression/dlog.c:58:38: runtime error: index 22 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
shared secrets are equal
../src/kem/sike/external/P503/../compression/sidh_compressed.c:1031:26: runtime error: index 233 out of bounds for type 'const uint64_t [17][8]'
```

I haven't finish running it all for all tests; but if it is of interest, I can do that.

comment.body: Closing.  This was fixed by #827, and FireSaber passes when I run undefined behaviour sanitizer on current liboqs.

issue.title: openssl rsa noout
issue.body:
I need to remove the dots that are printed when generating RSA keys. where should I use the -noout command in the command below?
apps/openssl genpkey -algorithm rsa -out /home/pi/openssl/CA-project/csr/key_srv.key -noout -pkeyopt rsa_keygen_bits:2048

comment.body: @prchander Is there an update from your side as to why you think this is an OQS issue? We'll otherwise close this.

issue.title: Allow building without std on nightly

comment.body: Probably. There's probably nobody who I should ask to review, right? (fortunately we have decent CI)

issue.title: openssl rsa noout
issue.body:
I need to remove the dots that are printed when generating RSA keys. where should I use the -noout command in the command below?
apps/openssl genpkey -algorithm rsa -out /home/pi/openssl/CA-project/csr/key_srv.key -noout -pkeyopt rsa_keygen_bits:2048

comment.body: @baentsch I reached out to upstream OpenSSL and it looks like the dots and pluses cannot be hidden. I do not think it is an issue but it would be very nice to have an option to remove them to get accurate results of key and signature generation.

issue.title: openssl rsa noout
issue.body:
I need to remove the dots that are printed when generating RSA keys. where should I use the -noout command in the command below?
apps/openssl genpkey -algorithm rsa -out /home/pi/openssl/CA-project/csr/key_srv.key -noout -pkeyopt rsa_keygen_bits:2048

comment.body: @prchander Do you think these outputs materially change the accuracy of keygen? I can't really imagine -- and that's probably the reason why the openssl team also leaves this in. So we also close this here -- also as we don't want to modify "classic" crypto code in our project.

issue.title: Allow building without std on nightly

comment.body: Ah, I also can't merge myself with how this repository is set up.
